distributeERC20(address,uint256).details: This loops over minters[] and will fail/gas out if minters array is huge. Use Merkle airdrop for large lists (recommended).

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

batchUpdatePoints(address[],uint256[]).notice: batch update (addresses[] and points[] must match length)

distributeERC20(address,uint256).notice: distribute `amount` of `token` to all recorded minters proportionally to their points.

emergencyWithdrawERC20(address,address,u.notice: withdraw any ERC20 accidentally sent to contract (owner only)

updatePoints(address,uint256).notice: update points for a single user
